subject: Design
title: Bauhaus Typography: The Font That Changed Reading
description: A fast breakdown of Bauhaus Typography: The Font That Changed Reading for builders.

hook.text: Herbert Bayer proposed abolishing capital letters in 1925. He called them redundant and elitist.

buildup.text: Bayer designed Universal, a geometric sans-serif that stripped letters to pure circles, lines, and arcs.

discovery.text: Universal influenced Futura, Helvetica, and every clean sans-serif font used in modern branding today.

twist.text: Bayer's dream of eliminating capitals failed. But his font philosophy conquered the world.

climax.text: Bauhaus typography proved that letters are designed objects â€” and redesigning them changes how we think.

punchline.text: Every clean font on your screen traces back to one Bauhaus student.

quiz.question: What radical proposal did Herbert Bayer make about typography?
options: Abolish capital letters as redundant and elitist
